writingAnswer.referenceEssay:
Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope this letter finds you well. I am delighted to hear about your interest in studying in China. Given your passion for engineering and your desire to immerse yourself in a vibrant academic environment, I would highly recommend Tsinghua University.

Tsinghua University, located in Beijing, is one of the most prestigious institutions in China. It is renowned for its strong engineering programs, particularly in areas like civil engineering and computer science. The university boasts state-of-the-art facilities, a diverse student body, and a faculty composed of leading experts in their fields. Additionally, its location in Beijing offers you the opportunity to experience China's rich cultural heritage and participate in a dynamic urban lifestyle.

The university also provides extensive support for international students, including language courses and cultural orientation programs, which will help you adapt to life in China. Furthermore, Tsinghua's strong connections with global industries and research institutions will provide you with invaluable networking opportunities.

I believe that Tsinghua University will not only meet but exceed your academic expectations. I am confident that your time there will be both enriching and rewarding.

Wishing you the best in your academic pursuits.

Warm regards,  
[Your Name]

translationAnswer.referenceTranslation: The full name of a Han Chinese person consists of a surname and a given name. The distinguishing feature of Chinese names is that the surname always precedes the given name. For millennia, the paternal surname has been passed down through generations. However, it is no longer uncommon today for a child to take the mother's surname. Generally, the given name comprises one or two characters, often embodying the parents' aspirations for their child. From a child's name, one can infer the kind of person the parents hope the child will become or the life they wish for them. Parents place great importance on naming their child, as the name often accompanies the child throughout their life.
